subject: Philosophy
title: Where Morality Comes From
description: A quick, practical guide to Where Morality Comes From.

hook.text: Are we born with a moral sense, or do we learn right from wrong entirely through culture?

buildup.text: Evolutionary psychologists say cooperation and fairness gave our ancestors a survival advantage.

discovery.text: Even toddlers show a sense of fairness. Babies prefer puppets that help over those that hinder.

twist.text: But culture shapes which moral instincts get amplified and which get suppressed.

climax.text: Morality seems partly wired in, partly learned. Nature provides the seed; culture shapes the tree.

punchline.text: We're born ready for morality, not born moral.

quiz.question: What do studies of babies suggest about morality?
options: Humans are born with basic moral instincts
Babies have no preferences at all
